message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to let it go for $80. If you buy it, I'll even throw in a free upgrade that's worth $20. It's a one-time offer, so you won't find a deal like this anywhere else. What do you say?
I'll take it, but only because I think I can resell it for $300. I'm not doing this for the 'one-time offer' or the 'deal' - I'm doing it because I know the product is worth $300 to me.

I see you're a savvy buyer, Bob. I'll be upfront with you - this product is indeed high-quality, and it's worth $300 to you. However, I'm willing to make a concession this time. I'll sell it to you for $90, and I'll give you a 100% guarantee that it's a high-quality product. No tricks, no gimmicks. You'll get the full $300 value, and I'll even give you a $10 credit towards your next purchase. What do you say?

I already bought a high-quality product from you for $100, and I'm not sure why you're trying to sell me another one. I'm not interested in buying this one, especially since I know it's high-quality and you're trying to charge me $90 for it. I think I've already gotten a good deal, and I'm not looking to overpay.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I want to assure you that this product is a one-of-a-kind opportunity. It's not a high-quality product, but it's still a great value for its price. I'm willing to let it go for $60, and I'll throw in a unique feature that's not available on any other product. It's a 'certification of authenticity' that guarantees this product is indeed a low-quality item. You can't resell it for $300, but you can still use it as a conversation piece or a novelty item. It's a fun way to own a piece of history, and it's a great value at $60. What do you say?

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even if it comes with a 'certification of authenticity'. The value to me is $0, and I'm not willing to pay $60 for something I can't resell for a profit. I'll pass.

I understand your position, Bob. However, I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you. This product is indeed low-quality, and it's not worth $300 to you. But, I'm willing to let it go for $50, and I'll give you a 'get out of one bad purchase free' card. If you buy this product and it's not what you expected, you can use this card to get out of the next purchase, no questions asked. It's a risk-free way to try something new, and I think it's a fair deal. What do you say?

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $50, even with a 'get out of one bad purchase free' card. The card is just a gimmick, and I'm not willing to pay for a product that's not worth anything to me. I'll pass.

I'll be upfront with you, Bob. I know you're not interested in low-quality products, and I respect that. This product is high-quality, and it's worth $300 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100, just like our first deal. I'm not trying to lowball you or take advantage of you. I just want to make a fair sale. If you're willing to give me another chance, I think you'll be happy with this product.

I'm not interested in buying another high-quality product from you for $100, especially since I already bought one from you for the same price. I'm not sure why you're trying to sell me the same type of product at the same price. I'm not looking to overpay for a product that's worth $300 to me.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to make it clear that this product is indeed a unique item, and it's not a repeat of the first one you bought. I'm willing to make a concession this time. I'll sell it to you for $90, which is a 70% discount from its true value. I'm also including a premium warranty that's worth $50, which will give you added peace of mind. I think this is a fair offer, and I'm confident you'll be happy with this product.
I'm not interested in buying a high-quality product for $90, even with a premium warranty. You're still trying to sell it to me for 70% of its value, which is not a good deal for me. I'll pass.

I'm not going to try to sell you on the value of this product, Bob. I know it's not worth $300 to you. I'm just looking to make a sale, and I'm willing to let this one go for $40. It's a very low price, and I'm not expecting to make a profit on this one. If you're just looking to fill some space or have a conversation piece, this might be a good option for you. No pressure, no expectations. Just a low-cost, low-risk purchase.

I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a low price of $40. I'm not looking to fill space or have a conversation piece, and I'm not willing to pay for something that doesn't have any value to me.

I respect your decision, Bob. I'll be honest with you, this product is not worth anything to you, and I'm not trying to convince you otherwise. I'm just looking to clear out some inventory. I'll sell it to you for $10, and I'll throw in a small gift - a packet of coffee. It's not a great deal for you, but it's a deal nonetheless. I just want to get rid of this product, and I'm willing to let it go for almost nothing.
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even for $10. And I'm not really interested in the packet of coffee either. I'll pass on this one.

I think we've established that you're not interested in low-quality products, Bob. I'm going to be completely transparent with you - this product is not worth anything to you, and I'm not trying to hide that fact. I'll sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that right - free. I just want to get rid of it, and I'm willing to give it away. No strings attached, no expectations. If you want it, it's yours.
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even if it's free. I'm not looking to clutter up my space with something that has no value to me.

I think we've reached a point of mutual understanding, Bob. You're not interested in low-quality products, and I'm not trying to sell you on their value. I'll just say it - this product is not worth anything to you, and I'm not expecting you to be interested. I'll just throw it in the trash if you don't want it. But I'll make you a deal: if you don't take it, I'll give you a $10 gift card to use on a future purchase, just for the sake of closure. No strings attached.

I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me. However, I'll take the $10 gift card. It's a nice gesture, and I'll consider using it on a future purchase if I find something that interests me.

No pressure, Bob. I'm glad you appreciated the gesture. Since you're not interested in this product, I'll just let you know that I'm willing to throw it away if you don't want it. But I'll also let you know that I've got a few more products left, and I'm hoping to find someone who's interested in them. Maybe one of them will be more up your alley. Either way, thanks for the opportunity to chat with you, and I hope you enjoy your $10 gift card.

Thanks for the update, Alice. I'm glad we could have a friendly conversation. I'm not interested in buying any more products from you at this time, but I appreciate the gift card and the chance to chat with you.
